intro: Deyeuxia confinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved wood sedge, is a grass-like plant belonging to the Cyperaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. This species typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and wet meadows. It produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are clustered at the ends of the stems. Deyeuxia confinis is often found in temperate regions and plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems.
